snippet: To the Editor:    Your report on the inquiry into the Rancho Santa Fe suicides (''In Serene Setting in California, a Suicide Investigation Unfolds,'' March 30) states that ''officials said the facts of the deaths could hardly be simpler.'' That ma...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your report on the inquiry into the Rancho Santa Fe suicides (''In Serene Setting in California, a Suicide Investigation Unfolds,'' March 30) states that ''officials said the facts of the deaths could hardly be simpler.'' That may be true from the point of view of a homicide detective or pharmacologist; but it is not true from the point of view of an observer interested in how and when these men and women obtained the substantial amount of phenobarbital (a controlled substance) that was necessary for the mass suicide.
abstract: Prof Thomas Szasz letter disputes March 30 article on inquiry into mass suicides of members of Heaven's Gate cult in California (S)

headline.kicker: Cultists' Deaths Call Our Insight Into Question
